org.latency4j.persistence

Class DefaultWorkDurationPersistenceManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.latency4j.persistence.DefaultWorkDurationPersistenceManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WorkDurationPersistenceManager

    public class DefaultWorkDurationPersistenceManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements WorkDurationPersistenceManager

    Default persistence manager shipped with the Latency4J toolkit. This implementation is file-based in the sense that it reads and writes durations to a specified location on the filesystem.

    • Field Detail

      • DATA_DIRECTORY_CONFIG_PARAM

        public static final java.lang.String DATA_DIRECTORY_CONFIG_PARAM

        Key ("data.directory") to the configuration parameter that specifies the directory to which duration files should be persisted. Note that if the specified directory does not currently exist, this manager will attempt to create it.

        Where not specified, this parameter defaults to the system temp folder as identified from the java runtime property Latency4JConstants.JAVA_TMP_FILE_FOLDER.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAX_HISTORICAL_DATA_FILESIZE_CONFIG_PARAM

        public static final java.lang.String MAX_HISTORICAL_DATA_FILESIZE_CONFIG_PARAM

        Key ("max.file.bytes") to the configuration parameter which specifies the maximum size of duration files.

        In order to prevent stale statistics on system startup, it is advisable to delete the duration files which have exceeded, reached or nearing this size so that the toolkit can replace them with more up-to-date records.

        The default value of this parameter is DEFAULT_MAX_FILESIZE.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_MAX_FILESIZE

        public static final long DEFAULT_MAX_FILESIZE

        The default value of the configuration parameter ( "max.file.bytes"kb).

      • loadHistoricalData

        public java.util.List<WorkDuration> loadHistoricalData(java.lang.String workCategory)
        Description copied from interface: WorkDurationPersistenceManager

        Loads all previously persisted duration instances for the given category, where such instances exist in the backing persistent storage.

        Specified by:
        loadHistoricalData in interface WorkDurationPersistenceManager
        Parameters:
        workCategory - The category of the requirement whose associated durations should be loaded.
        Returns:
        A list of previously saved duration instances for the given category, where they exist in the backing persistent store.
